5. **Learn basic rhythms**: Master basic time signatures such as 4/4 and 3/4, understanding note values rests and dynamics.

5. **Break down complex rhythms**: When learning new songs or rhythms break them down into smaller sections and focus on mastering each part before moving on.
5. **Learn basic rhythms**: Start with simple grooves in 4/4 time signature (common time) and gradually move on to more complex rhythms and time signatures.
5. **Learn basic rhythms and grooves**: Start with simple rock beats and gradually move on to more complex patterns.
5. **Break it down**: Break down complex rhythms or songs into smaller sections and focus on mastering each part before moving on.
5. **Break down songs**: Learn simple songs and break them down into smaller sections.
5. **Learn basic rhythms**: Once you're comfortable with basic strokes start learning basic rhythms like 4/4 time signature and common rock/pop/funk grooves.
6. **Play along with songs**: Playing along with your favorite songs will help you develop your timing feel and overall playing.
6. **Break it down**: Break down songs into smaller parts focus on one section at a time this will help you build confidence and master tricky sections.
6. **Break songs down into sections**: When learning songs break them down into smaller sections (intro verse chorus bridge) and focus on mastering one section at a time.
